item.title: Ghostlab Browser Testing Tool
item.description: Ghostlab is a tool for synchronized browser testing. It synchronizes scrolls, clicks, reloads and form input across all connected clients so that you can test a full user experience. http://vanamco.com/ghostlab/

item.title: Shim Browser Testing Tool
item.description: Shim is a node.js-based browser-compatibility tool that lets you synchronize several devices/browsers and surf the same pages simultaneously on all of them. https://github.com/antistatique/shim

item.title: Screensiz.es
item.description: screensiz.es displays a table of screen specifications including resolution and pixel density for popular devices and monitors currently on the market. Via Swissmiss http://screensiz.es/

item.title: Responsive Sketch Pad from UI Stencils
item.description: UI Stencils' responsive design sketchpad is made to help figure out breakpoints and how your product might translate to mobile and tablet versions. 2 device silhouettes on the front and 3 on the back. 50 pages on 70# paper in Letter or A4. http://www.uistencils.com/products/responsive-sketch-pad

item.title: Navigation Patterns for Responsive Design
item.description: I like Brad Frost's examples for handling both complex navigation and simple navigation needs on responsive designs. Via Leisa IAI Members http://bradfrostweb.com/blog/web/complex-navigation-patterns-for-responsive-design/

item.title: responsivepx
item.description: Responsivepx allows you to enter the url to your site (local or online) and use the controls to adjust the width and height of your viewport to find exact breakpoint widths in pixels. Then you can use that information in your media queries to create a responsive design. http://responsivepx.com/

item.title: Responsive Design Bookmarklet
item.description: Victor Coulon's Responsive Design Bookmarklet is a simple browser-based tool for testing your web layout in desktop, tablet and mobile phone dimensions. Save the bookmarklet, go to the page you want to test, then select the bookmarklet. It puts your page in a frame at the dimensions you want to test. Found via Takashi Sakamoto http://responsive.victorcoulon.fr/

item.title: Responsive.is: Display and present responsive web designs
item.description: Responsive.is is a clever tool. Enter a URL or append one to http://responsive.is to view how the layout presents itself on the Desktop, and in tablets and mobile phones. http://responsive.is/
